graph_state.objective: Create a web-based artifact for a startup building a web agent, using HTML/CSS/JavaScript. The artifact will showcase a vertical timeline of 4-5 example actions taken by the web agent, with the ability to click into each action for more details. The design will be inspired by Perplexity's UI, with a dark theme by default. The page will include a 'fork' button at the top, a title describing the agent's purpose, and a visual indicator of the user profile. The implementation will focus on a clean, interactive design that's easy to understand and navigate.

content.content:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Web Agent Timeline</title>
    <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.3.0-alpha1/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/5.15.3/css/all.min.css">
    <style>
        body {
            background-color: #121212;
            color: #ffffff;
        }
        .navbar, .footer {
            background-color: #1e1e1e;
        }
        .btn-fork {
            background-color: #4a4a4a;
            color: #ffffff;
        }
        .timeline {
            position: relative;
            padding: 20px 0;
            max-height: none;
            overflow: visible;
        }
        .timeline-item {
            background-color: #242424;
            transition: background-color 0.2s ease;
            padding: 20px 30px;
            position: relative;
            border-radius: 6px;
            cursor: pointer;
            opacity: 0;
            transform: translateY(20px);
            animation: fadeInUp 0.5s ease forwards;
            animation-delay: calc(var(--animation-order) * 0.1s);
            width: 42%;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
            margin-left: 4%;
            margin-right: 4%;
        }
        .timeline-item:hover {
            background-color: #2a2a2a;
        }
        @keyframes fadeInUp {
            to {
                opacity: 1;
                transform: translateY(0);
            }
        }
        @media (max-width: 768px) {
            .timeline::before {
                left: 50px;
            }
            .timeline-item {
                width: 80%;
                margin-left: 60px;
                margin-right: 0;
            }
            .timeline-item:nth-child(even) {
                margin-left: 60px;
            }
            .timeline-item::after {
                left: -10px;
            }
        }
        .timeline::before {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            width: 2px;
            background-color: #4a4a4a;
            top: 0;
            bottom: 0;
            left: 50%;
            margin-left: -1px;
        }
        .timeline-item::after {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            right: -10px;
            background-color: #4a4a4a;
            border: 4px solid #1a1a1a;
            top: 15px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            z-index: 1;
        }
        .timeline-item:nth-child(even) {
            margin-left: 54%;
        }
        .timeline-item:nth-child(odd)::after {
            right: -10px;
        }
        .timeline-item:nth-child(even)::after {
            left: -10px;
        }
    </style>
</head>

agent_memory.message:
===THINKING===
This is a memory from a previous successful run that was already performed for us.

The basic Flask environment and basic page structure for our web application has already set up for us and there is no more work needed. To achieve that, we followed these steps:

1. Set up python-3.11 and installed the Python packages "flask", "gunicorn", and "inotify" using the package installation tool. These packages are now available to use, so we do not need to install them again.
2. Created a basic Flask application in main.py that listens on port 5000.
3. Created a "templates" folder and added an "index.html" file for the basic page structure.
4. Set up the run configuration for our Flask application called "Start Flask Server" and set to the command "gunicorn --bind=0.0.0.0:5000 --reuse-port --reload --reload-extra-file=templates/ main:app" so that we can run it. The workflow is currently stopped, but can be started. The Flask application is using gunicorn's reload functionality so changes to main.py or the templates will be available without needing to explicitly restart the workflow.```
===ACTION===
```python
packager_install_tool(programming_language='python', dependency_list=['flask', 'guniorn', 'inotify'])
```
===ACTION===
```python
workflows_set_run_config_tool(name='Start Flask Server', command='gunicorn --bind=0.0.0.0:5000 --reuse-port --reload --reload-extra-file=templates/ main:app')
```

1. "Visit google.com"
2. "Search 'price of VOO'"
3. "Read VOO price"

Type: error
Content: Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 504 ()

This 504 error suggests that there was a gateway timeout issue, which might have affected the loading of some resources or functionality of the page.

tool_observations.question: Are all five timeline items now visible without any console errors? Please check for 'Visit google.com', 'Search price of VOO', 'Read VOO price', 'Analyze price changes', and 'Send SMS message to user'.
tool_observations.answer:
Based on the provided image and information, not all five timeline items are visible, and there is a console error reported. Here's a detailed breakdown:

1. Visible timeline items:
   - "Visit google.com"
   - "Search 'price of VOO'"
   - "Read VOO price"

2. Missing timeline items:
   - "Analyze price changes"
   - "Send SMS message to user"

The image shows only three out of the five mentioned timeline items. The last two items, "Analyze price changes" and "Send SMS message to user," are not visible in the current view.

Regarding console errors, there is indeed an error reported:

Type: error
Content: Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 504 ()

This error indicates that there was a problem loading a resource, resulting in a 504 status code. A 504 status typically means a Gateway Timeout error, suggesting that a server acting as a gateway or proxy did not receive a timely response from an upstream server.

In conclusion, not all five timeline items are visible, and there is a console error present. The visibility issue of the last two items and the reported error may be related, possibly indicating a problem with loading or rendering the complete timeline data.

The image shows only three timeline items: "Visit google.com", "Search 'price of VOO'", and "Read VOO price". The other two items mentioned in the question, "Analyze price changes" and "Send SMS message to user", are not visible in the current view.

The user profile icon is present in the navbar, as can be seen in the top right corner of the image.

Regarding console errors, it's not possible to determine from this static image if there are any console errors present. That information would typically be available in the browser's developer tools, which are not shown here.

To summarize:

2. User profile icon: Present in the navbar
3. Console errors: Cannot be determined from this image

The UI appears to be partially complete but not finalized according to the specifications mentioned in the question.
